intro: Coreopsis baumii, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features upright, branched stems that can grow up to 6 feet tall, covered in rough, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like yellow flowers with dark purple centers, blooming from late spring to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Coreopsis baumii is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for native gardens.
